Company Profile: LIXIN Group has deep rooted in Cambodia, and possessed great strength in development, planning and service. We start with excellent construction vision, establish many great construction projects that bloom on this land. Also, respond accordingly to the government’s development policies, and massive infrastructure and transportation projects, LIXIN Group made national urban planning for the next ten years, twenty years, and even thirty years. Through local constructions, we can attract more business or investors to come to Cambodia, and thereby accelerate the prosperity speed of Cambodia. In addition to real estate development industry, LIXIN Construction is diversified, which includes business property, tourism property. We adhered to all-comprehensive and international mindset in order to promote Cambodia construction industry which would make the world stunned.利鑫集团深入柬埔寨多年，拥有开发、规划、招商及国际物管等稳健的产业实力。以卓越建设视野为先导，聚集城市圈带的发展战略，并因应官方的开发计划、各地大型交通建设，拓展出全国未来十年、二十年、乃至三十年后的阶段性城市新兴规划，我们力争成为城市中心的缔造者。 利鑫集团希望，透过在地建设，能为各城市吸引更多国际商贸企业进驻，连带提升就业机会、促进人口成长，进而加速城市的繁荣脚步，因此，除了地产开发，我们旗下建设事业更含括商业地产、旅游地产等多元面相，秉持全方位、国际化思维，力求让柬埔寨建设进入崭新的境界，成为令世界赞叹的高端产业象征。Company Video 公司影片https://www.lixin-kh.com/cn/news_videoFacebookhttps://www.facebook.com/KhLiXin

Job Description:
- Consolidate all financial statements of Group Operation (2 divisions) including monthly/quarterly and annual account
- Prepare monthly, quarterly, yearly financial Statements
- Close income statement and balance sheet
- Check monthly cash flow and bank statement
- Check monthly tax report
- Check monthly payroll
- Supervise daily operations of accounting and finance department
- Setting up the policies for operation of account department
- Implement the internal control system
- Ensure all financial reporting deadlines are met
- Prepare all financial management report
- Ensure accurate and timely monthly and year end close
- Resolve accounting discrepancies and irregularities
- Prepare the document required by auditor during internal/External audit
- Ensure accurate and appropriate recording of revenues and expenses
- Review all financial documents and formats are complied with company’s accounting and financial policy manual
- Ensure accurate reports and recommend corrective measure to senior management for cost reductions and earning improvement
- Check all sales promotions and sales scheme profitability before approval from top management, according to remaining profit and break event point
- Check sales incentive calculation monthly according to target
- Check all expense before approval from top management
- Perform other necessary tasks as assigned General Manager or Top Management
- Preparation of the Group’s Divisions monthly profit and loss accounts
- Work with the board to review potential disposals and acquisitions
- Ensure high standards of financial control are maintained throughout
- Overseeing the production of the year end statutory financial statements and management accounts
- Management of group and board reporting
- Working capital management
- Overall management of the finance team
Job Requirement:
- Master Degree of Finance or ACCA
- Strong leadership and good business acumen
- Experience with budgets and forecasting
- Proactive, challenging and creative idea to resolve the problem
- Strong business acumen and ability to work under tough conditions
- Multi tasks and strong organization skills
- Analytical skills
- Pleasant personality, positive attitude & open-minded
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
- Computer literate – Ms Word, Excel, Power point, Internet and email
- Ability to work quickly and thoroughly when under pressure
- Must be flexible and open to changes in procedures
- Flexible time of work
Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

- Motivated and ready to accept day to day challenges
- Honest, and good commitment
- Excellent communication skill
- Proficient in Ms. Office
- Proficient in English language
- Communicative in Chinese is advantage.

Job Description: • Daily site inspection of the architectural trade and materials. Ensure construction and installation is correct follow drawings, specification and contract.• Maintain proper filing system during the entire project.• Ensure that any tests in accordance to the contractual specifications or statutory requirements are carried out at the site by the appointed contractor and thereafter report the outcome of the tests to the Architect/Consultants.• Issue of NCR and site memo, to be vetted by Project Manager, to contractor as and when defective works are identified or incorrect building materials are used or safety policies and procedures are not adhered to or good housekeeping not observed so as to ensure that immediate remedial actions are taken to safeguard the Company’s interest.• Keep daily record of events that happened at work site which include weather reporting, state and progress of work, the manpower at site etc, using standard formats report forms as well as update on the report chart so that the Project Manager can monitor the timely completion of the project.• Report discrepancies in contract drawings or specifications as and when they are identified and any technical issues unresolved at work site to the Project manager/ Construction Manager so that alternative plan of action could be provided.• Accompany any local authority personnel during their site inspection and record the outcome of their visits for the Consultants’ attention and action.• Attend site meetings with, Consultants, Project Manager, and Contractors to update on the work progress and to resolve any technical issues, whenever required or designated by Project Manager/Construction Manager.
Job Requirement: • Proven experience as Architect / RTO or relevant role• Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics• Organizational and leadership abilities• Excellent interpersonal and public speaking skills• Aptitude in problem-solving• Bachelor’s Degree in Architect, Civil Engineering, or a related field.
Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

1- HLH Agriculture (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia.

Job Description: - Maintaining the information system and computer networks.- Ensures that all systems are functional and secure.- Manages and supervises the activities and operations of the information Technology unit including hardware, software, network, telephone, and computer systems administration.- Identifies and recommends cost-effective technology solutions for all aspects of the organization.1. IT Infrastructure:- Ensure all network connections are functioning well, this includes servers to be working properly.- Maintain and administer the company server, website, and other web programs.- Manage and ensure effectiveness of servers, including e-mail, and backup servers, and their associated operating systems and software.- Design and implement short- and long-term strategic plan.- Conduct research, evaluate, and recommend server technology for future implementation.2. ERP System Implementation:- Plan and oversee the implementation of ERP systems, ensuring that the project is delivered within budget, scope, and timeline.- Ensure that the ERP system meets the business requirements, enhances the operational efficiency of the company, and aligns with the company’s IT strategy.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business users, IT staff, and external vendors, to analyze business processes, gather requirements, design, and configure the ERP system.- Manage the ERP system’s infrastructure, including hardware, software, databases, and servers, to ensure that it is secure, stable, and reliable.- Manage project risks and issues, proactively identify, and resolve any problems, and ensure that the system is tested and validated before go-live.- Train end-users, create user manuals, and support users in the adoption of the new ERP system.- Manage maintenance and upgrades of the ERP system, ensuring that it continues to meet business requirements and that any changes are properly documented and communicated.- Develop and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders, including senior management, business users, and IT staff.3. Mobile App DevelopmentThe manager of this function needs to oversee the performance of the team of mobile app developer as following:- Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models- Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application- Fixing bugs and performance problems- Writing clean, readable, and testable code- Cooperating with back-end developers, designers, and the rest of the team to deliver well-architected and high-quality solutions

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. Job Description:
- Maintaining the information system and computer networks.
- Ensures that all systems are functional and secure.
- Manages and supervises the activities and operations of the information Technology unit including hardware, software, network, telephone, and computer systems administration.
- Identifies and recommends cost-effective technology solutions for all aspects of the organization.
1. IT Infrastructure:
- Ensure all network connections are functioning well, this includes servers to be working properly.
- Maintain and administer the company server, website, and other web programs.
- Manage and ensure effectiveness of servers, including e-mail, and backup servers, and their associated operating systems and software.
- Design and implement short- and long-term strategic plan.
- Conduct research, evaluate, and recommend server technology for future implementation.

2. ERP System Implementation:
- Plan and oversee the implementation of ERP systems, ensuring that the project is delivered within budget, scope, and timeline.
- Ensure that the ERP system meets the business requirements, enhances the operational efficiency of the company, and aligns with the company’s IT strategy.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business users, IT staff, and external vendors, to analyze business processes, gather requirements, design, and configure the ERP system.
- Manage the ERP system’s infrastructure, including hardware, software, databases, and servers, to ensure that it is secure, stable, and reliable.
- Manage project risks and issues, proactively identify, and resolve any problems, and ensure that the system is tested and validated before go-live.
- Train end-users, create user manuals, and support users in the adoption of the new ERP system.
- Manage maintenance and upgrades of the ERP system, ensuring that it continues to meet business requirements and that any changes are properly documented and communicated.
- Develop and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders, including senior management, business users, and IT staff.

3. Mobile App Development
The manager of this function needs to oversee the performance of the team of mobile app developer as following:
- Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models
- Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application
- Fixing bugs and performance problems
- Writing clean, readable, and testable code
- Cooperating with back-end developers, designers, and the rest of the team to deliver well-architected and high-quality solutions
Job Requirement:
• A recognized bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• A minimum of 03-years’ experience in the role of Manager
• Experience including but not limited to: Microsoft Visual Studio Development, .NET Framework, .Net Core, C#.Net, MVC, ASP.Net, Bootstrap, Dev Express, JavaScript, jQuery, XML and XSL, IIS, SQL Server, T-SQL, TFS (etc.)
• Good command of English communication, both spoken and written
• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
- Expertise in IT Infrastructure LAN/WAN, IT Server and PC installation &
configuration, Microsoft Window Server 2022, window Services and
troubleshooting
- Expertise in Backup and Store solution.
- Expertise in Cisco routing and switching.
- Good understanding and maintain company domains and websites.
- Good experience in NetApp storage, NAS, and Cisco Server.
- Experience in budget planning and good management skills.
- Good in ERP System.

Job Description:

• Install and maintain application software and computer operating systems.
• Work with prepress supervisor to develop, implement, and maintain imaging and prepress workflow procedures.
• Perform related duties as assigned.
• QA design for errors
• Implement feedback and changes whenever possible

• Bachelor’s degree or higher in a creative field
• Proficiency in programs such as Adobe Suite, Photoshop, InDesign, QuarkXPress, Illustrator and imposition software
• Attention to detail
• Portfolio of work with a wide range of creative projects
• Strong analytical skills
• Time management and organizational skills
• Knowledge of layouts, graphic fundamentals, typography, print, and web
• Experience with both print and digital media

company_name: ក្រុមហ៊ុន ម៉េងលី ជេ. គួច អេឌ្យូខេសិន (Mengly J. Quach Education)
Job Description: - Oversee the school campus.- Plan for and execute the continuous growth of the campus.   - Read and respond to teaching and non-teaching staff term report.- Monitor student, teaching and non-teaching staff opinion survey and result.- Prepare teaching schedule.- Monitor personnel management (staff details, staff requisition, CV shortlist, contract, timesheet check, leave check, monthly staff movement, salary addition and deduction, absence record, etc.)- Establish and maintain professional and cooperative working relationships with all stakeholders: parents, students, staff, neighbors, and partners.- Supervise school and public safety and school maintenance.- Supervises the maintenance of student records, including assessment results, test scores, discipline citations, and other documents.- Prepare and process field trip requests.- Maintain and update school website regularly.- Prepare and maintains purchase orders and other expense records; approve, and monitor expenditures and ensure expenditures are within budget allowances for the year.- Prepare necessary forms to hire, upgrade, terminate or authorize special payments to staff.- Recruit qualified and experienced teachers and staff. - Plans, assigns, trains, and evaluate classified staff in accordance with school standards, timelines, and procedures.- Plan the arrangements for school contests and events and community activities.- Act as liaison between school and other schools, the parents, outside agencies, and the public.- Develop, implement, and monitor work practices, systems, and methods that are effective, efficient, and consistent with school standards, policies, and procedures.- Prepare annual school calendar and plan the arrangements for school contests and events and community activities.- Promote and maintain a positive and effective school climate by ensuring that all interactions with staff, students, parents, and the public at large are prompt, efficient, helpful and friendly.- Seek out and participate in educational and professional development. - Recognize problems and impediment and report them promptly with solutions to the President- Monitor and analyze student performance assessment data preparing reports as needed for various special projects.- Perform other duties as assigned by Chairman and President- Read all comments from the student opinion survey about their teachers and the school as a whole. Take actions on those comments where and when applicable. - Read all comments or complaints sent by the Information Office. Solve them where and when applicable. - Update all handbooks regularly, usually termly, based on the changes of the policies. - Go and check each cafeteria twice per week in each building and write a report and then submit to the Office of the President every week. - Do the CBC round as schedule. -​ Get the P&L, CF, BS of each business and service units every month from Finance Department. Call for a meeting with those business and service units every month.
Job Requirement: - Master degree in Education or related field- Management experiences in education and related fields- Excellent problem solving skills, and able to use initiative - Ability to patiently work with people from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, religious views- Ability to calmly manage and prioritize multiple tasks- An approachable and friendly spirit, easy to smile and a can-do attitude- Excellent computer skills with the MS Office Suite and proficient with Social Media- Ability to understand and keep within a budget- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English- Strong administrative and organizational skills.How to apply!Submit your CVs to our Talent Acquisition Team (TAT),Via email to: hr@mjqeducation.edu.khTelegram: https://t.me/HRMJQETel: (855) 12 797 939, (855) 93 335 564
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse

- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training

• 4 years of OB-GYN residency

• 2 years+ experience as an obstetric or abdominal ultrasound technician
• Proficient at patient charting and knowledgeable in relevant charting computer program

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh #11A, St. 402 Sangkat Tomnup teuk, Khan ChomkaMorn. phnom penh 012 797 939

Job Description: - Read and publicize all official memo(s) to students, attend all meetings and orientation at the beginning and/or throughout the term (meetings and orientation are mandatory).- Teach Literacy and numeracy along with personal, social and emotional skills.- Employ a variety of instructional techniques and teaching strategies to meet different aptitudes and interests of students, including whole group/ small group or individual learning.- Follow course syllabus provided by Aii Language Center. Help with the integration of technology into the classroom, helping set up computers and projectors, for example.- Be well planned for her/ his class. Job Description: - Develop and maintain web applications from concept to deployment, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.- Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.- Design user-friendly and visually appealing front-end interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks.- Implement and maintain robust APIs and web services for seamless communication between the front-end and back-end systems.- Build and optimize databases, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval.- Write clean, modular, and well-documented code using best practices and coding standards.- Perform thorough testing and debugging to identify and fix any issues or bugs.- Collaborate with the team to continuously improve development processes and tools.- Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends, and apply them to enhance the development process and improve software quality.

Job Description:
** ROLE
The Purchasing and Logistics Officer is responsible for assisting the OPMS Supply department as directed by the Senior International Purchasing Officer, and the Procurement Manager. This position is based at the Mondulkiri mine site on 4 weeks on, 2 weeks off roster.

** RESPONSIBILITIES
• Enter, update and maintain the item customs information excel database for international items being imported
• Perform Khmer translation for spare parts and other imported items
• Working closely with site to help classify the material, purpose, HS code, picture and further details of imported items to satisfy Cambodia customs requirements
• To compile, update, maintain the Commercial Invoice and Packing List (CIPL) of consolidated goods to be imported to align with Cambodia customs import requirements
• To assist with providing further details and information as per Cambodia customs request
• Expedite and handle shipments imported by Air, Sea, and Land from Freight Forwarder
• Ensure timely pick-up of shipments from the origin with reference to INCOTERMS
• Communicate closely with Freight brokers, freight forwarders, Cambodia Customs, and others to ensure all shipment documentation approval status, cargo pics, Khmer translation, and customs clearance process as per OPMS logistic points/checklist.
• Identify priority shipments and manage timely deliveries to the site, keeping required parties updated on the current status and expect site due date.
• Ensure timely reporting of freight status on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.
• Ensure critical/ P1 Priority and project freight is managed in accordance with expectations.
• Review vendor, Freight Forwarder, Broker invoices in accordance with OPMS PR, OPMS PO, supplier quotations and payment.
• Establish key relationships with Cambodia Customs.
• Maintain and update contact lists pertaining to transport and logistics providers.
• Liaise and aid other departments regarding customs and import duty issues on the import and export of goods.
• Coordinate with Finance, Procurement and End-user for supporting information, payment, and delivery schedule are need.
• Coordinate with broker/Bollore for customs clearance until delivery to End-user/Site.
• Ensure cargo is transported to the site safely and securely.
• Follow up and update news from government regulation for Logistic function and customs processes.
• Check purchase requisitions for approvals and appropriate authority limits.
• Assist with the Accounts Payable function (data entry, coding, and processing).
• Process purchase orders resulting from requisitions.
• Ensures MACA procedure is adhered to in the procurement, receipt, warehousing, inventory, storage and issuing of materials, goods and services.
• Enter data into the purchasing and transport record spreadsheets accurately and in a timely manner.
• Responsible for the cost-effective procurement of goods and consumables requested.
• Receiving/updating information relating to invoices received for purchase orders.
• Participate and contribute to site inventory & stock control tasks including stock-taking, issuing, and receipting.
• Administration support as required.
• Actively participate and contribute to the continuous improvement and innovation of MACA work practices.
• Commitment, respect and compliance to the MACA safety, health and environment policies, MACA Safety Programs Fitness for Work policy and MACA’s vision and core values.

DESIRABLE
• Experience working in a mining site environment
• Strong mining spare parts experience and understanding
• International purchasing & logistics
• Experience dealing with Cambodia customs, HS code classification, import and export process
Job Requirement:
** BENEFITS
• Direct Family Health Insurance
• Salary Range ($700 - $900 gross / month)
• Meals and lodging provided when at mine site
• Strict adherence to Cambodia Labor Laws
• Company with international operations

** Job Requirements
• 2+ years’ experience in similar roles
• Position based at mine site in province of Mondulkiri 4 weeks on, 2 weeks off work roster
• A demonstrated mechanical aptitude
• Previous hands-on exposure to spare parts and maintenance items for mining and heavy-duty industrial machines and equipment
• A technical understanding of mining spare parts and their purpose / function
• Demonstrated experience in accessing machines / equipment parts books hard copy and online
• Strong administration and data entry skills, Microsoft Office with intermediate to advanced excel, word & email skills
• Ability to perform Khmer translation (written) of English import & export documentation to align with Cambodia requirements
• Strong communication, good English proficiency
Company Profile:
OPMS (CAMBODIA) CO., LTD. is the member of MACA Limited, a publicly listed, international contracting group offering services to the Mining, Infrastructure and Construction sector industry.

OPMS (CAMBODIA) CO., LTD. was registered as a Private Limited Company in Cambodia and is currently providing gold mining services at Okvau site, Mondulkiri Province. The scope of work for this project includes site preparation, drill and blast, load and haul, and maintenance work.

Company Profile: TOA is the leader of innovative and decorative paint manufacturer in South East Asia who offers and supplies a variety of demand by a plenty innovative painting solution system in both household and industrial market. More than 50 years of paint business, our products continue to gain an increasing share of the highly competitive in both international market and domestic sales due to our premium product quality and high service level.  With high standard and strong product portfolio, TOA has been growing faster than the industry average. We draw our strengths from the new products, best-managed behavior, and also strong sales force. Job Description:
- Create lesson plans; evaluate student performances; and teach using lectures, technology and hands-on learning experiences.
- Model expected behaviours to establish and maintain an orderly, disciplined classroom.
- Creating daily lesson plans and learning activities for students based on Cambridge International standards in English Language education and research and knowledge of developmental behaviours.
- Delivering high-quality, engaging instruction in the form of discussion, direct teaching, demonstrations and independent practice using a variety of proven methods.
- Differentiating lessons when needed to give all students access to the curriculum regardless of disability, instructional level, English proficiency or level of interest in the subject.
- Evaluating student performance on tasks established by the standards using different methods such as observation, performance-based tasks or other standard test practices.
- Maintaining a safe, orderly and supportive classroom by modelling expected behaviours and standards, promoting positive interactions and quickly addressing behaviours that are not in line with the school discipline plan.
- Communicating with parents regarding student progress, potential and behaviours periodically through phone or electronic means and at parent and teacher conferences.
Job Requirement:
- Degree in related majors
- Competent in Information Technology for use in Teaching and Learning, as well as data analysis
- Strong knowledge in curriculum, pedagogy and assessments.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting is an advantage.
- Minimum 2 years of working experience in education institutions.
- Strong passion in education with the ability to inspire students
- Willing to work flexibly in dynamic and fast-paced environment
- Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
- Strong ability in leadership, networking, teamwork, and problem-solving
- Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines
Company Profile:
At World International School Cambodia (WISC), our aim is to create an enabling environment for children to maximize their potential in a holistic manner, so that they are an academically, socially and ecologically literate global citizen in our increasingly culturally diverse world.

Your child, as a potential global citizen, will have several educational pathways availed to him or her as a student for WISC to have the opportunity to choose a sought after education pathway to help his or her academic ambitions.

Your child will also be equipped and provided with life skills reflective of the WISC Learner Profile which is developed with the sole purpose of helping your child to be creative, innovative, caring and a responsible young adult, with a fostered inclination to design, innovate, problem solve and communicate effectively.

World International School Cambodia (WISC) in Cambodia offers a comprehensive Singapore Primary Schools Program, combined with the Cambridge’s International General Certificate for Secondary Examination (IGCSE) courses. We look forward to welcoming you to our global community.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR  Department  069 56 56 70 hr@wisc.edu.kh TUEK L’AK Head Office: Building # 431, Street 230, Sangkat Tuek L’ak III, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh 069 56 56 70

Job Description:
•	Responsible for the functionality and connectivity of the MIS office with the campus
•	Providing IT support – hardware, software and systems to all different user groups in the campus
•	Managing the daily operational IT needs, including managing, monitoring, maintaining and upgrading existing IT systems e.g. servers, operating systems, hardware, software, printers and scanners
•	Assisting to ensure the smooth functioning of the VIOP phone system
•	Managing the camera and sound system for security and class room delivery
•	Managing the IT inventory and assets at optimal level
•	Network Management to achieve efficiency of workflow and security
•	Other duties relevant to IT support in a changing environment

•	At least a Bachelor degree in BIS, computer science or other relevant fields
•	At least 3-5 years of experience in IT Support
•	A strong team player 
•	Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines

Job Description:
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Oversee Accounting Transaction 
•Manage the daily operations of the accounting department including month and end-year process accounts payable/receivable Cash receipts
•Monitor and analyse accounting data and produce financial reports or statements
•Establish and enforce proper accounting methods, policies, and principles
•Establish and maintain fiscal files and records to document transactions.
•Overdue accounts should be reported to CFO and provide instructions as to a plan to collect the accounts
•Check the payment status of amounts in the Accounts Payable summary. Overdue accounts, which are not paid are inquired to the colleagues for an explanation
•Verify various reserves and amortization/ depreciation are accounted for properly per the tax laws and accounting regulations
•Check the monthly account statements, verifying all numbers, and determining, settlement deadline
•Check daily AR and AP team
•Reconcile daily sales transaction with bank statement and accounting system to ensure it's matched
•Control Stock in and stock out accurately and correctly with proper supporting documents and authorized signature
•Ensure the stock report from POS system is correct and no minus. In addition, alert to management if some items are almost expired/ nearly expired in order to sale out on time.
•Do a monthly stock count for each outlet to make adjustment with accounting system and keep as record for next month stock counting.
•Surprise check on expensive items to reduce the loss\damage
•Other tasks as assigned by line manager/ CEO/Chairwomen.
Job Requirement:
•Proven working experience as Accounting or Finance  Supervisor/Manager
•Advanced computer skills on MS Office, accounting software and databases, other update systematic 
•Proven knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles, practices, standards, laws and regulations
•High attention to detail and accuracy
•Ability to direct and supervise
•Degree in Accounting or Finance

- Communicating with parents regarding student progress, potential and behaviours periodically through phone or electronic means and at parent and teacher conferences.
Job Requirement:
- Degree in related majors
- Competent in Information Technology for use in Teaching and Learning, as well as data analysis
- Strong knowledge in curriculum, pedagogy and assessments.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting is an advantage.
- Minimum 2 years of working experience in education institutions.
- Strong passion in education with the ability to inspire students
- Willing to work flexibly in dynamic and fast-paced environment
- Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
- Strong ability in leadership, networking, teamwork, and problem-solving
- Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines
Company Profile:
At World International School Cambodia (WISC), our aim is to create an enabling environment for children to maximize their potential in a holistic manner, so that they are an academically, socially and ecologically literate global citizen in our increasingly culturally diverse world.

Your child, as a potential global citizen, will have several educational pathways availed to him or her as a student for WISC to have the opportunity to choose a sought after education pathway to help his or her academic ambitions.

Your child will also be equipped and provided with life skills reflective of the WISC Learner Profile which is developed with the sole purpose of helping your child to be creative, innovative, caring and a responsible young adult, with a fostered inclination to design, innovate, problem solve and communicate effectively.

World International School Cambodia (WISC) in Cambodia offers a comprehensive Singapore Primary Schools Program, combined with the Cambridge’s International General Certificate for Secondary Examination (IGCSE) courses. We look forward to welcoming you to our global community.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR  Department  069 56 56 70 hr@wisc.edu.kh TUEK L’AK Head Office: Building # 431, Street 230, Sangkat Tuek L’ak III, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh 069 56 56 70

Company Profile: Urban Hub Cambodia is a multi-award-winner and one of Cambodia’s biggest fully licensed real estate developers. Job Description:
•Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the sales team.
•Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company’s customer base and ensures its strong presence.
•Own recruiting, objectives setting, coaching and performance monitoring of sales representatives.
•Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs.
•Develop a sales strategy to achieve organizational sales goals and revenues.
•Set individual sales targets with sales team.
•Ensure the sales team have the necessary resources to perform properly.
•Monitor the achievement of sales objectives by the sales team.
•Provide feedback, support and coaching to the sales team.
•Plan and direct sales team training
•Assist with the development of sales presentations and proposals.
•Develop promotional ideas and material for management take consider and approve for sale volume hit company target.
•Take initiative for hit sales volume close deal
•Organization and planning
•any task as assigned by line manager/CEO.
Job Requirement:
•At least 2 years of experience as a Sale supervision. 
•Degree of Marketing or any related field.
•Strong communication skills.
•Good in innovative creative.
•Understanding customer needs.
•Strong result orientation and problem-solving skills.

Job Description:
** Reporting Line: IT Manager

** Key Responsibilities:
- Provide general IT assistance to support the NAMOS Version upgrade to all stations
- Provide Technical support on checking Network/ cabling
- Provide maintenance of computers and printers, when needed, and other IT equipment to ensure that they are working well
- Provide maintenance assistance to employees
- Other tasks may be assigned by IT Manager
Job Requirement:
- Educational background: A freshly graduated student of Computer Science, Information Technology or others related field is encouraged to apply
- Skill: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking. Knowledge of IT helpdesk, IT hardware and software maintenance and troubleshooting
- Knowledge: MS Office, Internet and Email proficiency
- Willing to learn, honest and be able to work under pressure
- Language: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking.
- Period of intern: 6 months up to 1year

** Applications should be submitted via sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com or to our Head Office, ANINA Building 6th Floor, No 240, St. 271, B.P600, 12351 Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.
Company Profile:
TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. (previously called TOTAL Cambodge) is an affiliate of TotalEnergies, a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people. 

TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been officially operating in Cambodia since 1993. Throughout the country, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been involved in marketing various energy and lubricants products and services to its customers in both the private and public sectors. We offer a wide range of products through more than 100 service stations with over 52 Bonjour Shops, Industrial fuels, Aviation fuels and lubricants. Through the TotalEnergies Card, customers are offered a convenient way to make and manage fuel purchases. Other services offered include used oil analysis, tank installations and bulk deliveries to many of our Commercial customers.

In view of supporting its growth in Cambodia, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.  is looking for a talented and motivated candidate for the position as follow:


Applications should be submitted via email: sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com *Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms Lypy LY   sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com ANINA Building 6th Floor, No 240, St 271, Beoung Tumpun, Meanchey, Phnom Penh – CAMBODIA

Job Description:

- Support dispatcher for optimization of truck utilization
- Review the signed delivery notes of completed deliveries.
- Monitor the Trucks with the GPS System (Delays/Route Deviation from Journey Plan/ Unplanned Stops/etc.)

Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE
The People Experience Manager (Cambodia) is responsible for driving all people related matters and managing the day-to-day implementation of People Experience (PX) initiatives and policies in both operational and strategic levels to achieve high performance and high engagement organisation. 
The role will be working closely with the Country Director (CD), Country Leadership Team (CLT), Regional PX Director (RPXD) and the PX teams in both Regional and Global offices, to develop and deliver a number of work programs and campaigns aiming to provide our people with the best
employment experience across all three business units: Student Placement, IELTS and English Language Teaching, and support functions.
 Manage employee lifecycle processes from attraction and acquisition of talents to on-
boarding, capability and career development through to exit and separation.
 Support and advise the management team to provide great work environments for our
people through supporting facility management, occupational health and safety and
broad administration activities specifically for the Cambodia’s offices
 Deliver great employee experiences through effectively administrating employee
processes and records in SuccessFactors (personnel database)
JOB ANNOUNCEMENT AT IDP

JOB DESCRIPTION
An ASX100 business part that is owned by Australian universities, IDP is a pioneer in international
education services. Our core business lines include student placement to Australia, US, UK, Canada
and New Zealand institutions, English-language testing and training. 
We are on a mission to build the world's leading platform and connected community to guide students
along their journey to achieve their lifelong learning and career aspirations.
As a co-owner of IELTS, we deliver the English test that is trusted by more governments, universities
and organisations than any other. We also operate English language teaching schools in South East
Asia. 
We are innovators, driven by the needs of our customers and deep data insights. Our 5,000 team
members based around the world understand that our services change lives – not only of our
customers, but their wider communities. 
By combining empathy and professional expertise with digital excellence, we create launch pads for our
customers to achieve global success. 

POSITION PURPOSE
The People Experience Manager (Cambodia) is responsible for driving all people related matters and
managing the day-to-day implementation of People Experience (PX) initiatives and policies in both
operational and strategic levels to achieve high performance and high engagement organisation. 
The role will be working closely with the Country Director (CD), Country Leadership Team (CLT),
Regional PX Director (RPXD) and the PX teams in both Regional and Global offices, to develop and
deliver a number of work programs and campaigns aiming to provide our people with the best
employment experience across all three business units: Student Placement, IELTS and English
Language Teaching, and support functions. 

- Directly support CD and CLT to create a collaborative work environment across departments through effective internal communications via such channels as internal social network website (JAM), emails, bulletin boards, newsletters, town hall, social events, and instant messaging groups, etc.
- Collaborate with the Regional and Global PX teams to implement new projects and campaigns to improve and enhance employees' experiences.
- Oversee payroll data preparation, and coordinate with the Finance department to ensure pay is made to the employees correctly and on time
- Oversee the statutory compliance together with Global Privacy Data Officer

RESPONSIBILITIES 
 People Data and Process Integrity:  
- Accountable for accuracy and up-to-date data of people information in SuccessFactors
(SF)
- Collaborate with the RPXD and SF team in designing, testing and implementing new modules in SF
- Drive an adoption of the internal social media, JAM, to deliver a great people experience through regular content contributions and active participation in relevant discussions and topics.
- Effectively identify opportunities to digitise people process administration to increase effectiveness and enhance employment experience Talent Acquisition & On-boarding:
- Manage and facilitate the talent acquisition process by collaborating with both internal (hiring managers, CD, RPXD) and external (internal recruiting team, IDP Career Portal,
recruitment agencies, job posting websites, candidates) parties through an effective use
of the dedicated Application Tracking System (JobScore) to attract, recruit and hire high
quality talent into the organisation
- Ensure an effective and efficient talent acquisition process to provide a positive experience for hiring managers as well as candidates
- Conduct analysis, assess recruitment results, and identify areas of opportunity and change. Use the data to evaluate sourcing effectiveness, determine progress and
process improvement
-  Manage onboarding and induction program to provide new joiners with a smooth and seamless onboarding experience. Ensure that new joiners are properly oriented about the Company
Job Requirement:
-  Bachelor’s degree or higher in HR Management, Business
Studies/Administration/Management or related field
- Minimum 10 years of working experience of which 7 must be in HR function
- Minimum 5 years of experience in leading HR function for a medium to large MNC organization (min. 100 pax)
- Excellent fluency in Khmer AND English in both speaking and writing to collaborate with local, region and global teams
- Sound understanding of the principles underpinning great employee experiences and Cambodia labour laws
- Effective communication and interpersonal skills, and able to engage effectively with all levels of the organisation
- Highly organised, meticulous, able to prioritise and multitask with minimal supervision
- Demonstrated ability to manage internal and external relationships
- High degree of initiative and advanced problem-solving skills
- Proficient in Microsoft suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
- Proactive personality with positive influence on our people

- Only candidates with the rights to work in the country will be considered. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted by recruiter

Desirable Experience:
- Proactive to implement process improvements
- Experience working in MNC with matrix organisation setting
- Experience in SAP and payroll processing

The Opportunity
The Head of Finance is a key leadership role at IDP Cambodia. You will lead the IDP Cambodia
finance function by overseeing the overall financial performance management, ensuring high
standards of compliance are met and driving process improvement. You are responsible for
leading change in the development of a first-class finance function while supporting the Country
Director - Cambodia and Regional Finance Director - SEA.

Adept at handling ambiguity

Job Description:
** POSITION PURPOSE
The Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies
for the various business streams, relationship management and the supervision and training of a
team of young professionals. This position is responsible for instilling a marketing led ethos
across IDP Cambodia, developing integrated annual marketing plans for the key business
streams, and establishing and building upon strategic relationships. The position must work
consultatively and responsively with both internal and external stakeholders and manage and
foster professional skills development in a team of junior staff who are responsible for events,
publications, advertising, and external and internal communications.
RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Strategy
 Develop and agree comprehensive annual / quarterly / monthly marketing plans that
successfully support the achievement of country goals across business lines within
agreed timeframes and to expected quality standards
JOB ANNOUNCEMENT AT IDP

- Design and agree multi-channel marketing campaigns, including details of the intended
source of leads, numbers of leads and related activities that will enable execution of the campaigns
- Work with Office Managers in developing and supporting effective execution of activity calendars including in-office activities and outreach initiatives
- Devise appropriate Public Relations strategies as required and in line with business needs
- Build and maintain strong relationships and communication with the regional marketing team to leverage learning from the wider region on best practices across marketing areas
2. Lead Generation
- Collaborate with key stakeholders to plan and execute all lead generation initiatives in a highly effective manner, which meet the required number of leads by source, enabling
the country team to maximise the sales opportunities / business results
- Identify new opportunities for generating leads and make recommendations to Country
Director on the proposed investment and projected outcomes to initiate theses new marketing initiatives
- Challenge the status quo by introducing creative and innovative ideas to the
management team for consideration
3. Event Marketing & Contact Centre Management – Lead Qualification
- Plan, schedule and execute marketing activity to support the successful operation of IDP
events. This includes pre-event marketing and all activities relating to the event itself
- Prepare marketing & booth designs (with support from Regional Team) and ensure IDP
is presented to participants in line with strategic goals and brand positioning
- Evaluate the success of marketing events from feedback received from both clients and students and improve
- Local Contact Centre setup and management, working closely with Regional Contact
Centre team
-  Support Contact Centre team to qualify the web leads as per the defined targets
- Contact Centre performance reporting and monitoring
4. Analytics and Reporting
- Make effective use of analytics to evaluate effectiveness of marketing campaigns and
track numbers of qualified lead generated vs. target for each destination
- Proactively escalate / highlight issues, when necessary, along with ideas of how to
improve lead numbers and lead quality
5. Digital Marketing (led by Regional Digital Marketing team)
- Work with the Regional Web Marketing team to ensure that the local website is maintained and updated to inspire students and to meet agreed objectives
- Drive effective use of websites by developing and implementing SEO/SEM strategies with the Regional Web Marketing team. This includes developing content that will drive students to seek out IDP’s website
- Work closely with Regional Web Marketing team to generate web leads through multiple
online platforms (Google, Facebook etc.)

6. Vendor and Agency Management
- Identify, build and maintain relationships with relevant vendors, agencies, and partners to​​ increase the business success and ensure high quality outcomes for IDP Cambodia
- Create corporate and government links to improve PR and partnership opportunities your team can leverage
7. Team Leadership
- Lead, develop and maintain a high performing team that will deliver IDP’s key marketing objectives from a corporate unit perspective
- Create an environment that delivers opportunities for collaboration and co-operation
across the wider regional marketing teams
- Set performance targets for key performance indicators for team ensuring all delegations are clear
- Contribute to building a positive work environment within the team based on a shared commitment to IDP’s values and quality
- Build and maintain strong relationships and communication with regional office to leverage all marketing strategies & material that is developed
8. Financial Management
- Manage budget and resource allocations effectively to deliver business priorities
- Exercise appropriate stewardship over IDP assets and intellectual property
- Expenditure is in line with agreed budget and business priorities
9. General
- Undertake any other lawful duties as reasonably directed by management
Job Requirement:
 Educated to Graduation level or equivalent
 Minimum five years work experience in a mid-level marketing role, or at least eight years
relevant work experience
- Background in the successful delivery of strategic marketing activities
- Experience in budget management
- Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
- Demonstrated high level written and oral communication skills including the ability to prepare high quality materials and communication products for print and digital media
- Knowledge of contemporary marketing and communication practices and technological environments
- Outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively in a cross- cultural setting
- High level of personal initiative combined with the ability to work collaboratively with other staff
-  Ability to inspire, manage and supervise staff, including the ability to establish priorities and meet competing deadlines

*** Desirable Requirements
- Accomplished knowledge of the education industry
- Experience in working in dynamic global environment
Women and Disabled People are strongly encouraged to apply.

Company Profile:
Established in 2021, Mango Finance PLC is a digital microfinance startup based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capitalized by an investment from Vipar Auto FZCO, Dubai. With direct access to over 100,000 customers, we are capturing the opportunity to lend digitally and securely.

Mango Finance PLC intends to transform the microfinance landscape in Cambodia by leveraging the powers of technology and data. We believe in improving access to capital for the unbanked in Cambodia, with our proprietary credit scoring engine.

Mango Finance PLC is a licensed Microfinance Institution, regulated by the National Bank of Cambodia. Please visit www.mangofinance.net for more information.

Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

1- HLH Agriculture (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
2- HLHI (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
3- Royal Hong Lai Haut One Company Limited.
4- Jewel A Development Co., Ltd.
5- Agri-Oral Joint Cooperate Co., Ltd.
6- Public Housing Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
7- PH One Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

position: អ្នកជំនាញអប់រំកុមារពិសេស
Job Description: អ្នកជំនាញអប់រំកុមារពិសេស មានភារកិច្ចទទួលខុសត្រូវលើការងារសំខាន់ៗដូចខាងក្រោម៖ក. គ្រប់គ្រងកម្មវិធីរៀន និងបង្រៀនខ. ការងារជំនាញអប់រំពិសេសគ. ការងារគ្រប់គ្រងរដ្ឋបាលឃ. ការងារគ្រប់គ្រងទូទៅង. ការងារប្រាស្រ័យទាក់ទងក្នុងក្រុមច. ការរៀបចំកម្មវិធី និងចាត់ចែងក. គ្រប់គ្រងកម្មវិធីរៀន និងបង្រៀន​  1. បង្កើត និងរៀបចំកម្មវិធីសិក្សាទៅតាមកម្រិត និងបញ្ហារបស់សិស្ស។  2. រៀបចំគ្រូ និងសិស្សទៅតាមកម្រិតថ្នាក់។  3. ពិនិត្យ និងរៀបចំសម្ភារឧបទេសបង្រៀនដល់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូតាមតម្រូវការ និងការស្នើសុំ។  4. រៀបចំកញ្ចប់សិក្សាទៅតាមតម្រូវការរបស់សិស្ស។  5. ប្រមូល និងពិនិត្យកម្មវិធីសិក្សារបស់គ្រូតាមខែនីមួយៗ។  6. ដោះស្រាយរាល់គ្រប់បញ្ហាសិស្សជាមួយនឹងអ្នកគ្រូបន្ទុកថ្នាក់។  7. ជួបមាតាបិតា ឬអ្នកអាណាព្យាបាលសិស្សទាក់ទងនឹងការអភិវឌ្ឍរបស់សិស្សជាមួយ និងគ្រូបន្ទុកថ្នាក់។  8. ផ្តល់ការប្រឹក្សាដ៏ល្អសម្រាប់បុគ្គលិកអប់រំពិសេស។  9. រក្សាការសម្ងាត់ទាំងសិស្ស និងបុគ្គលិក។  10. តាមដានការបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូ និងការរៀនរបស់សិស្សានុសិស្សតាមរយៈការចុះអង្កេតថ្នាក់ និងចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យ (Do ខ. ការងារជំនាញអប់រំពិសេស  1. ចុះអធិការកិច្ច និងវាយតម្លៃលើការបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូ និងធ្វើការផ្តល់មតិយោបល់លើការបង្រៀន។  2. រៀបចំដំណើរការប្រជុំក្រុមបច្ចេកទេសបង្រៀនតាមខែនីមួយៗ។  3. ដឹកនាំលោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូរៀបចំ និងអភិវឌ្ឍកម្មវិធីសិក្សាប្រចាំឆ្នាំ។  4. ការចុះសង្តេតខ្លីលើការបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូ (Spot Check)។  5. ធ្វើការស្រាវជ្រាវចំណេះដឹងផ្សេងៗដើម្បីអភិវឌ្ឍខ្លួន គុណភាពបង្រៀន និងគុណភាពសិក្សារបស់សិស្ស  ស្របតាមគុណភាពអប់រំនៃបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពរបស់ប្រទេស និងពិភពលោក។  6. ធ្វើកិច្ចតម្រង់ទិសចំពោះបុគ្គលិកថ្មីទាក់ទងនឹងការអប់រំពិសេស។គ. ការងារគ្រប់គ្រងរដ្ឋបាល  1. សម្ភាស និងវាយតម្លៃសិស្សថ្មីដែលចូលរៀននៅសាលាអប់រំពិសេស ព្រមទាំងចេញជារបាយការណ៍។  2. គ្រប់គ្រងលើការងារគ្រូបង្រៀន សិស្សានុសិស្ស និងបុគ្គលិកការិយាល័យសិក្សា។  3. គ្រប់គ្រង និងធ្វើឯកសាររដ្ឋបាលដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធផ្សេងៗរបស់សាលាអប់រំពិសេស។  4. រៀបចំគម្រោងផែនការការងារប្រចាំឆ្នាំសាលាអប់រំពិសេស។  5. ចូលរួមប្រជុំគណៈកម្មការសាលារៀន អន្តរទ្វីប អាមេរិកាំង និងគណៈកម្មការអគារ។  6. ចូលរួមប្រជុំជាមួយគណៈគ្រប់គ្រងសាលា ឬស្ថាប័នផ្សេង ផ្នែកផ្សេងៗតាមការចាត់ចែងរបស់នាយក/នាយិកា ចាងហ្វាង ឬប្រធានសាលារៀន អន្តរទ្វីប អាមេរិកាំង។  7. ចូលរួមប្រជុំរៀបចំផែនការការងារសម្រាប់ឆ្នាំសិក្សាបន្តបន្ទាប់។  8. ត្រួតពិនិត្យការងាររដ្ឋបាលថ្នាក់រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូ។  9. បង្កើតទម្រង់វាយតម្លៃសមត្ថភាពសិស្សសម្រាប់ការផ្លាស់ប្តូរកម្រិតថ្នាក់។  10. រៀបចំការប្រជុំបូកសរុបការងារអប់រំប្រចាំខែជាមួយលោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូបន្ទុកថ្នាក់។ឃ. ការងារគ្រប់គ្រងទូទៅ  1.	គ្រប់គ្រងគុណភាពវិន័យ ការបង្រៀន និងរៀន ព្រមទាំងធ្វើឱ្យគុណភាពបរិស្ថានរបស់សាលាល្អជាប្រចាំ។  2. គ្រប់គ្រងការងារដែលខ្លួនទទួលបន្ទុកប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់។  3. គ្រប់គ្រងកម្មវិធីសិក្សាថ្នាក់អប់រំពិសេសប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់។  4. រៀបចំគោលដៅ និងបេសកកម្មសម្រាប់ការងារផ្ទាល់ខ្លួន។  5. ធានាលើការងារបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូប្រចាំថ្ងៃប្រកបដោយគុណភាព និងប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់។  6. សម្របសម្រួលការងារបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រូប្រចាំថ្ងៃ។  7. រៀបចំ និងត្រួតពិនិត្យការងារប្រចាំថ្ងៃ។  8. វាយតម្លៃលើការងារទូទៅ និងបច្ចេកទេសបង្រៀនរបស់លោកគ្រូ អ្នកគ្រួ។  9. រៀបចំជ្រើសរើសបុគ្គលិកគ្រូបង្រៀនតាមតម្រូវការរបស់សាលា។  10. សហការ ចូលរួម និងជួយគ្រប់គ្រងរាល់កម្មវិធីផ្សេងៗដែលសាលាតម្រូវឱ្យចូលរួម។ង. ការងារប្រាស្រ័យទាក់ទងក្នុងក្រុម  1. យកចិត្តទុកដាក់ស្តាប់ និងយល់ពីតម្រូវការដៃគូទំនាក់ទំនង។  2. មានភាពរីករាយជាមួយដៃគូទំនាក់ទំនង។  3. បំពេញតម្រូវការដៃគូទំនាក់ទំនងឱ្យបានទាន់ពេលវេលា។  4. យកចិត្តទុកដាក់ឆ្លើយតបជាមួយដៃគូទំនាក់ទំនង។  5. បង្កើតបរិយាកាសល្អជាមួយដៃគូទំនាក់ទំនង។ច. ការរៀបចំកម្មវិធី និងចាត់ចែង  1. ត្រូវរៀបចំផែនការការងារឱ្យមានប្រសិទ្ធភាព តាមប្រតិទិនសាលាដែលបានកំណត់។  2. ចាត់ចែងការងារទៅតាមតួនាទីរបស់ខ្លួន ដោយផ្តល់ព័ត៌មានទៅនាយក/នាយិកាចាងហ្វាង។
Job Requirement:
• មានសញ្ញាបត្រផ្នែកការអប់រំកុមារពិសេស។
• មានបរិញ្ញាបត្រ ឬបរិញ្ញាប្រជាន់ខ្ពស់ លើមុខជំនាញអប់រំ ឬសញ្ញាបត្រដែលមានតម្លៃស្មើ។
• មានចំណេះដឹងលើភាសាបរទេសជាពិសេសលើផ្នែកភាសាអង់គ្លេស។
• មានសមត្ថភាពគ្រប់គ្រងការងារជំនាញអប់រំពិសេស ការងាររដ្ឋបាល។
• មានបទពិសោធគ្រប់គ្រងលើផ្នែកអប់រំយ៉ាងតិច៥ឆ្នាំ។
• មានសមត្ថភាពប្រឹក្សាយោបល់ និងដោះស្រាយបញ្ហាសិស្ស បញ្ហាគ្រូ។
• មានចំណេះដឹងផ្នែកចិត្តវិទ្យាគរុកោសល្យ។
• មានចំណេះដឹងខាងផ្នែកព័ត៌មានវិទ្យាប្រើប្រាស់បានលើកម្មវិធី៖ Words, Ms. Excels, Power Point, Internet, and Email.
• មានសមត្ថភាពក្នុងការធ្វើការងារជាក្រុម។
• មានសមត្ថភាពក្នុងការដឹកនាំក្រុម៖ ធ្វើផែនការ អនុវត្ត តាមដាន វាយតម្លៃ។
• មានសមត្ថភាពវិភាគស្ថានភាពសិស្ស ៖ ការសិក្សា សុខភាព គ្រួសារ និងសង្គម។
•មានមនសិការជាអ្នកអប់រំ។
• មានភាពសច្ចៈទៀងត្រង់ និងមានទឹកចិត្តស្រលាញ់កុមារ។
• តស៊ូអត់ធ្មត់  សម្របសម្រួល ផ្តួចផ្តើមនិង ច្នៃប្រឌិត។
• គោរពម៉ោងការងារបានទៀងទាត់។
• មានស្វ័យយ័តភាពនៅក្នុងការងារ។
• មានសមត្ថភាពធ្វើការនៅក្រោមសំពាធ។
• គោរពទៅតាមទស្សនវិស័យរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន។
• គោរព និងប្រតិបត្តិតាមបទបញ្ជាផ្ទៃក្នុងរបស់ស្ថាប័ន។
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh Building #223 & 227, Mao Tse Tong Blvd., Sangkat Toul Svay Prey I, Khan Boeng Keng Kang, Phnom Penh 012 797 939

Job Description: - Perform daily Marketing. - Increase sale volume of loan product to achieve target. - Check daily loan proposals. - Site visit new borrowers. - Check loans in arrear and repayment. - Supervise activities of loan officers. - Submit loan documentation for Credit Committee meeting. - Semi-authorize for all medium and big loan sizes. - Check monthly Loan report. - Check overdraft statement submitted by responsible loan officer. - Monitor loan arrear on a monthly basis. - Monitor, follow up all selling process and deal with the customer. - Keep up-to-date of the bank’s latest products. - Maintain relationship with existing and new customers, refer new customers to new services to promote business for the bank.
